static string getName(string $territoryCode, string $locale = '')

Retrieve the name of a territory/subdivision (country, continent, .

..).

Parameters

string $territoryCode The territory/subdivision code
string $locale The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set in \Punic\Data

Return Value

string Returns the localized territory/subdivision name (returns $territoryCode if not found)

at line 51
static string|array getCode(string $territoryCode, string $type)

Retrieve the code of a territory in a different coding system.

Parameters

string $territoryCode The territory code
string $type The type of code to return. "alpha3" for ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 codes, "numeric" for UN M.49, "fips10" for FIPS 10 codes or "internet" for top-level domains

Return Value

string|array returns the code for the specified territory, or an array of codes when $type is "internet", or an empty string if the code is not defined for the territory or the territory is unknown

Exceptions

ValueNotInList throws a ValueNotInList exception if $type is not valid

See also

http://unicode.org/reports/tr35/tr35-info.html#Supplemental_Code_Mapping

at line 87
static string getByCode(string $code, string $type)

Retrieve the territory code given its code in a different coding system.

Parameters

string $code The code
string $type The type of code provided. "alpha3" for ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 codes, "numeric" for UN M.49, "fips10" for FIPS 10 codes or "internet" for top-level domains

Return Value

string returns the code for the specified territory, or null if the code is unknown

Exceptions

ValueNotInList throws a ValueNotInList exception if $type is not valid

See also

http://unicode.org/reports/tr35/tr35-info.html#Supplemental_Code_Mapping

at line 163
static array getContinentsAndCountries(string $locale = '')

Return a list of continents and relative countries. The resulting array is in the following form (JSON representation): ```json { "002": { "name": "Africa", "children": { "DZ": {"name": "Algeria"}, "AO": {"name": "Angola"}, .

.. } }, "150": { "name": "Europe", "children": { "AL": {"name": "Albania"}, "AD": {"name": "Andorra"}, ... } } ... } ``` The arrays are sorted by territory name.

Parameters

string $locale The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set in \Punic\Data

Return Value

array

at line 191
static array getList(string $levels = 'W', string $locale = '')

Return a list of some specified territory/subdivision, structured or not.

$levels control which data you want to retrieve. It can be one or more of the following values:

  • 'W': world
  • 'C': continents
  • 'S': sub-continents
  • 'c': countries
  • 's': subdivisions

If only one level is specified you'll get a flat list (like the one returned by {@link getContinents}). If one or more levels are specified, you'll get a structured list (like the one returned by {@link getContinentsAndCountries}).

Parameters

string $levels A string with one or more of the characters: 'W' (for world), 'C' (for continents), 'S' (for sub-continents), 'c' (for countries)
string $locale The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set in \Punic\Data

Return Value

array

Exceptions

BadArgumentType

See also

http://www.unicode.org/cldr/charts/latest/supplemental/territory_containment_un_m_49.html
http://www.unicode.org/cldr/charts/latest/supplemental/territory_subdivisions.html

Return Value

array The list of territory IDs for which we have some info

at line 262
static array|null getLanguages(string $territoryCode, string $filterStatuses = '', string $onlyCodes = false)

Return the list of languages spoken in a territory.

Parameters

string $territoryCode The territory code
string $filterStatuses Filter language status.

  • If empty no filter will be applied
  • 'o' to include official languages
  • 'r' to include official regional languages
  • 'f' to include de facto official languages
  • 'm' to include official minority languages
  • 'u' to include unofficial or unknown languages
string $onlyCodes Set to true to retrieve only the language codes. If set to false (default) you'll receive a list of arrays with these keys:

  • string id: the language identifier
  • string status: 'o' for official; 'r' for official regional; 'f' for de facto official; 'm' for official minority; 'u' for unofficial or unknown
  • number population: the amount of people speaking the language (%)
  • number|null writing: the amount of people able to write (%). May be null if no data is available

Return Value

array|null Return the languages spoken in the specified territory, as described by the $onlyCodes parameter (or null if $territoryCode is not valid or no data is available)

static array getTerritoriesForLanguage(string $languageID, float $threshold = 0)

Return a list of territory IDs where a specific language is spoken, sorted by the total number of people speaking that language.

Parameters

string $languageID The language identifier
float $threshold The minimum percentage (from 0 to 100) to consider a language as spoken in a Country

Return Value

array

Return the code of the territory/subdivision that contains a territory/subdivision.

Parameters

string $childTerritoryCode

Return Value

string return the parent territory/subdivision code, or an empty string if $childTerritoryCode is the World (001) or if it's invalid

at line 414
static array getChildTerritoryCodes(string $parentTerritoryCode, bool $expandSubGroups = false, bool $expandSubdivisions = false)

Retrieve the child territories/subdivisions of a parent territory.

Parameters

string $parentTerritoryCode
bool $expandSubGroups set to true to expand the sub-groups, false to retrieve them
bool $expandSubdivisions set to true to expand countries into subdivisions, false to retrieve them

Return Value

array Return the list of territory codes that are children of $parentTerritoryCode (if $parentTerritoryCode is invalid you'll get an empty list)
